intro: Peucedanum muriculatum, commonly known as the European hogweed, is a flowering plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It is characterized by its tall, branched stems and large, umbrella-like clusters of small white or greenish-white flowers. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, sunny environments and is part of the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots. However, it contains toxic compounds and should be handled with care.
